page.title: 11PAPWORTH'S STORAGE CENTRE(i)
page.content: In November,1981,G.G.Papworth Ltd. took over the closed Sugar Beet Factory for a Distribution and Storage Centre.The 64 acre site has 150,000 square feet of covered warehouse space and large outside storage areas. The new Ely by_pass gives access to main roads and a large number of rail sidings link directly with the main railway lines.Papworths can deal with 16 commodities a day and the shunting locomotives can move trains of 1,000 tonnes each.These carry road salt and potash from Cleveland ,fertilisers and soda ash for glass_making from Billingham_On_Tees ,molasses from Bristol Sugar factories and cattle feedstuffs.From France comes mineral water and resin for paint_making from Germany,Italy and Spain Some packaging materials for local Ely firms is also stored here.
